meanings.sent1: The whitewashers painted the walls of the old barn.
meanings.sent2: The whitewashers were hired to freshen up the exterior of the house.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kids pretended to be whitewashers and painted each other with white paint.
meanings.sent4: The artist used the concept of whitewashers to symbolize purity and simplicity in his painting.
meanings.sent5: The whitewashers transformed the dingy walls into a bright and clean space.

meanings.definition: A person who covers up or glosses over faults or wrongdoings.
meanings.sent1: The company hired whitewashers to hide their unethical practices.
meanings.sent2: Politicians often employ whitewashers to make their scandals seem less serious.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked that his cat was a master whitewasher, always getting away with mischief.
meanings.sent4: In the courtroom drama, the defense attorney was portrayed as a skilled whitewasher of the truth.
meanings.sent5: The PR team acted as expert whitewashers, spinning the negative story into a positive one.
